org.svvrl.goal.gui.tool

Class AbstractTransitionTool<T extends Automaton>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.AbstractAction
      • org.svvrl.goal.gui.action.WindowAction<O>
        • org.svvrl.goal.gui.action.EditableAction<T,java.lang.Void>
          • org.svvrl.goal.gui.tool.Tool<T>
            • org.svvrl.goal.gui.tool.AutomatonTool<T>
              • org.svvrl.goal.gui.tool.AbstractTransitionTool<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the automaton
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.Action, Drawer, TabSwitchedListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AltTransitionTool, FSATransitionTool, GameTransitionTool, TwoWayAltTransitionTool

    public abstract class AbstractTransitionTool<T extends Automaton>
extends AutomatonTool<T>
implements java.awt.event.ItemListener
    An AbstractTransitionTool is the abstraction of tools that create transitions.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • isTransitionAllowed

        protected boolean isTransitionAllowed(State f,
                                      State t)
        Returns true if a transition from state f to state t is allowed. By default, a transition is always allowed.
        Parameters:
        f - a source state
        t - a destination state
        Returns:
        true if a transition from state f to state t is allowed

      • isLabelRequired

        protected boolean isLabelRequired(State f,
                                  State t)
        Returns true if a label is required for a transition from state f to state t. By default, a label is required if the label of the automaton is on transitions.
        Parameters:
        f - a source state
        t - a destination state
        Returns:
        true if a label is required for a transition from state f to state t

      • startTransitionEditing

        protected void startTransitionEditing(java.awt.Point p)
        Starts the editing of a transition label at a specific location.
        Parameters:

      • applyTransitionEditing

        protected void applyTransitionEditing()
        Applies the effect of the transition label editing and stops the editing.

      • getSymbol

        protected java.lang.String getSymbol(java.lang.String input)
        Returns the symbol in a user's input. By default, the whole user's input is the symbol.
        Parameters:
        input - a user's input
        Returns:
        the symbol in a user's input

      • createTransition

        protected Transition createTransition(T aut,
                                      State from,
                                      State to,
                                      java.lang.String symbol,
                                      java.lang.String input)
        Returns a new transition in a specified automaton. The source state of the transition is from while the destination state is to. Other properties are determined by the user's input input.
        Parameters:
        aut - an automaton
        from - the source state of the returned transition
        to - the destination state of the returned transition
        symbol - a formatted label of the returned transition
        input - the user's input for creating the transition
        Returns:
        a new transition in the automaton based on the user's input

      • containsTransition

        protected boolean containsTransition(T aut,
                                     State from,
                                     State to,
                                     java.lang.String symbol,
                                     java.lang.String input)
        Returns true if in a specified automaton there is a transition that has a specified source state, a specified destination state, a specified label, and other properties specified in the user's input.
        Parameters:
        aut - an automaton
        from - the source state of the returned transition
        to - the destination state of the returned transition
        symbol - a formatted label of the returned transition
        input - the user's input for creating the transition
        Returns:
        true if in the automaton there is a transition that has the source state, the destination state, the label, and other properties specified in the user's input

      • stopTransitionEditing

        protected void stopTransitionEditing()
        Stops the editing of a transition label.
